settings.title: What is Pay What You Can?
settings.answer:
Our unique Pay What You Can-model lets you choose your own price for your artwork, knowing that what you choose to give will help support an important cause. The artworks we curate are valued at up to 465USD, we chose to have a lower starting price so we can leave room for donations in our â€œChoose your donationâ€ section.Â 

It's a never before seen way to use the power of art to make the world a better place.

settings.title: Why do you have a â€œChoose your donationâ€ section?
settings.answer:
Andy okay started Art for Causes because we all are at different financial positions at different times in our lives, and are able to give different amounts. By having the â€œChoose your donationâ€ section you can still get amazing art from independent artists and give what you can in a form of a donation to our charity partners.

Each donation is valued equally, and appreciated as much. Art for Causes is for you no matter what. Just give what you can. Because every dollar matters.

settings.title: What if I choose the lowest amount possible?
settings.answer:
This is a team effort. Art for Causes was created because we all are at different financial positions at different times in ur lives, and are able to give different amounts.

If you only can give the lowest amount, that is fine. Don't feel bad. Your purchase is made possible by someone that could give $49, $99 and even $149 for their art.

Each donation is valued equally, and appreciated as much. Art for Causes is for you no matter what.

Just give what you can. Because every dollar matters.

settings.title: Who chooses the cause for the artwork?
settings.answer:
Each year we officially partner up with a few charity organisation to help them spread awareness and raise donations through the power art. We work with both large organisations such as WWF and Rainforest Trust and smaller ones such as Artists Building Communities and Animal Love.Â 

The artists can then choose which of our charity partners they want to link to their specific artwork.

settings.title: What is "Charity of the month"?
settings.answer:
Each month we focus a little more attention on a specific charity partner we are working with, to spread awareness about their mission and vision.

This selected partner becomes the center of attention on many different levels. It features everything from engaging posts in our social channels to the pre-set cause for artists we are collaborating with during that month.Â

settings.title: Can I choose a different cause?
settings.answer: Yes, you can choose from any of our charity partners that we work with during the year.

settings.title: How do I know the money will reach the organisation?
settings.answer:
We believe in full transparency and we have official partnerships with our charity organisations. Â 

Follow us on social media (IG / FB) where proof of donation will continuously be posted.

Of course, you're always welcome to contact us with any questions.

settings.title: I'm an artist
settings.answer:
We're always on the lookout for eyecatching art. Do you think your designs would suit our store? We welcome those of you who are as passionate about creating as you are about our planet for potential partnerships and collaborations.

Please send us an email with a link to your portfolio, instagram, or any other media you got. We'll be happy to take a look. Send us a message.

settings.title: We're an organisation
settings.answer: Andy Okay helped raise awareness and bring attention to important issues for organisations such as WWF, Rainforest Trust, UN, Give Back To Nature, Climate Save Movement and many others. We'd love to talk about what we can do together. Contact us here.

settings.title: I'm a blogger/influencer
settings.answer:
We love to partner up with those of you who work as influencers in social media channels.

To create a good collaboration it's important that your Instagram page is a good fit to our vision content wise. Art, nature, sustainability, styling or interior design etc.

If you believe that your content does match our products, feel free to contact us. We look forward to hearing from you!

settings.title: Do you represent the press?
settings.answer:
Press representatives are welcome to contact us for press loans, press images and other PR-related materials. When using our images, we request that you refer to us.

Please contact us here.

settings.title: Why do you release so few of each product?
settings.answer: Each artwork is officially licensed by an independent artist and linked to a specific cause. We want you to own something truly unique. Something special. Mass producing something really takes away from this feeling.

settings.title: I really want an item, but it's sold out? Is there any way to get it?
settings.answer:
We totally understand, but when an item is gone, it is gone. However you will get many more chances - our collection may be limited, but we release new art regularly.

Make sure you sign up to our Members Club to get a first notice on every new drop.

settings.title: Will the products be numbered?
settings.answer: We found that this made some of the items more valuable than others. Since we want each piece to have the exact same value, we removed the numbering.

settings.title: How can I track my order?
settings.answer: You will receive a notification when your order leaves our warehouse, usually within 24-48h. This email will include a tracking link so you can follow your art all the way to your home.

settings.title: Can I cancel or change my order?
settings.answer: We can't guarantee that we'll have enough time to cancel or change your order, as our fulfilment team pride themselves on getting products heading our customers' way quickly. But if you contact us as soon as possible we may be able to arrange it. Please send us an email.

settings.title: How long will it take to get my order?
settings.answer:
It depends on where you are. Most orders will take around 3-7 business days to arrive. Some deliveries to more remote areas can take a little bit longer. Shipment details will be sent to you as soon as your package has been shipped.

If you haven't received your art within 9 business days, feel free to use our Track My Order-service or contact us so we can investigate your shipment. Please make sure to contact us within 30 days of when your order was made at the latest, otherwise we can't make claims or investigate the shipment with the freight company.Â

settings.title: Are frames included?
settings.answer:
Frames are not included. But we print everything in standard sizes so you can easily find the frames you like locally.

The Fine Art prints are printed in inches in the US and centimeters in the rest of the world.

settings.title: Where is the art shipped from?
settings.answer: Our Fine Art prints are printed, checked and shipped from our own facility in Sweden. Our professional team has over 70 years of experience printing high quality art. This way we can make sure that everything from the paper choice, printing quality and packaging process is just perfect each time.Â

settings.title: What are the shipping rates?
settings.answer: We ship all over the world, and offer free shipping on all orders above $69. If your order value is below $69 we have a flat shipping rate of $5.99 to cover some of our shipping costs.

settings.title: Can I make changes to my order after payment?
settings.answer: Unfortunately, we can't make changes to an existing order, but if you contact us as soon as possible, we may be able to cancel the order before it leaves our stockroom. Then, after the order has been cancelled, you can go back in and place a new order with the correct items. This way, you can avoid being billed for two orders.

settings.title: Will there be any custom fees?
settings.answer:
We can guarantee that there are no customs fees or import taxes on orders from Europe, the US, Australia, New Zealand and Turkey.

Customs fees may apply to orders from the UK if the order value exceeds Â£135.

Customs fees may apply to orders from Canada and Switzerland.

The fee may vary depending on order value, country limits, etc. You as a customer is responsible for these fees and they are charged directly by the shipping provider or your local tax office.Â If you have any questions send us an email.

settings.title: What if I don't pick up my order?
settings.answer:
You have up to 14 days to collect your parcel from your pickup spot and you will be reminded two times within this period to pick up your parcel.

If you fail to pick up your parcel within this period, it will be returned to our fulfillment warehouse. You will need to speak to customer services regarding your refund.

Please notice that you will be charged for the delivery charges for your un-collected order, even if you reached the "free shipping" level.

settings.title: Can I pay with card?
settings.answer: Yes, you can pay with most credit cards, such as Visa, Mastercard, AMEX etc.

settings.title: Can I pay with Paypal?
settings.answer: Yes, it is possible to pay with paypal.

settings.title: Can I pay with invoice?
settings.answer: No, unfortunately we can not offer invoice payment method.

settings.title: Can I return my product?
settings.answer: We always aim to make sure our customers love our products, but if you do need to return an order, weâ€™re happy to help. Just email us directly and weâ€™ll take you through the process. You can read more about our return policy under Shipping & Returns

settings.title: How do I exchange a product?
settings.answer: If you would like to exchange a received product for something different, it is processed like a regular return. You send us the item you donâ€™t want and we will refund you. You can then proceed to place a new order on our website.

settings.title: What should I do if a product is damaged or incorrect?
settings.answer:
In the event that you receive a defective or incorrect item, we want to make it right as soon as possible. Please email the following information to us:

- Order number
- Customer name
- Product name
- Photo of damaged or incorrect item.

Our customer service team will get back to you with a solution straight away.

settings.title: When will I recieve my refund?
settings.answer: We make every effort to issue your refund as soon as possible, and at the latest within 14 days. Please note that we must have received your order return or a mailing receipt before we can issue a refund.

settings.title: Just contact us. We're happy to help!
settings.answer: Send us an email at support@andyokay.com or contact us through our contact page! We will be happy to assist you.

settings.review_text: I came across this site completely by accident but I'm so happy I did. I absolutely LOVE this print. Everyone who comes in my house comments on it. Delivery was fast and the print arrived in perfect condition.

settings.title: Follow Andy okay on IG
settings.subheading: More than art. Every day on IG we feature in depth stories about our artists, and the inspiration behind the art they've created. Check it out!

settings.title: WE GIVE BACK, TOGETHER
settings.content:
â€œMerging good causes and epic art into something truly meaningful on your wallâ€ - Variety

The idea was to create an art gallery never before seen.Â  To make exclusive high-quality gallery art affordable for everyone, and at the same time make the customer a part of a better future.Â 

Today, art and earth lovers all around the globe are giving anything from $2 to $200 extra for their artwork, knowing that the more they chose to pay, the more positive impact it creates.

settings.title: MEET ANDY
settings.content:
Announced a â€World Heroâ€ by WWF, Andy has over 20 years of experience creating art that tells important stories.

Working hand-in-hand with organisations like UN, Peta, Save Movement, WWF, Rainforest Trust and many more, Andy understands the needs of the communities being served and the power art has to raise awareness.

Art for Causes is the product born after 20 years of networking with amazing artists all around the globe, and important organisations of all sizes. And a need to do more.

Click here for an interview with Andy
15min read

settings.text: Artworks sold for charity

WeÂ exist toÂ help nonprofits do their world-changing work.Â Andy okay raises money to important causes by offering incredible limited edition art for a price YOU decide. What you give for your art will benefit an important organisation.

settings.heading: Give to Charity by Purchasing Art
settings.paragraph: Andy okay is rooted in the belief that we have a responsibility to protect and preserve the world we live in. You buy, and we'll give. Let's use the power of art to create change, one artwork at a time.

settings.heading: You buyÂ an artwork
settings.paragraph: Find the art you love and pay what you want for it. Every artwork on the site benefits an important organization. Â

settings.heading: We send money
settings.paragraph: The more you spend, the more we send. What you choose to give will support a nonprofit do their world-changing work.

settings.heading: Together for better
settings.paragraph: With the artists, we choose which projects to support, making sure the donations ends up in the right hands.Â

settings.heading: Our Mission
settings.paragraph: We want to use the power of art to create change. Real change.Â As environmentalists and artists our mission is to guide you on your journey and empower you to do your best when it comes to the environment. You don't have to be a hardcore environmentalist to make a difference. It's the little things, like riding your bike to work, bringing your own grocery bag, and buying an item that gives profits to charity - they all add up. Especially when thousands of other people start doing them too.

settings.heading: 1 Million To Charity by 2030
settings.paragraph: Our vision is to give 1 million to charity by 2030, which will help those organisations do their world-changing work. So far we've supported 12 important nonprofits and help them raise over $20.000.

settings.text: We work with charitable organizations all across the world and help them raise money with the power of art.

settings.heading: Big Change Start Small
settings.paragraph: Art has the power to bring visual and emotional pleasure to people, letâ€™s use this to at the same time benefit deserving charities everywhere. Every artwork sold benefits a cause.

settings.text: We work with charitable organizations all across the world to help them raise money with the power of art. We feature a different charity sitewide every month. By focusing our community's efforts on one cause at a time, we can work together to make an even bigger impact for each one.

We work with charitable organizations all across the world to help them raise money with the power of art. We feature a different charity sitewide every month. By focusing our community's efforts on one cause at a time, we can work together to make an even bigger impact for each one.

We work with charitable organizations all across the world to help them raise money with the power of art. We feature a different charity sitewide every month. By focusing our community's efforts on one cause at a time, we can work together to make an even bigger impact for each one.

We work with a different charity sitewide every month. By focusing our community's efforts on one cause at a time, we can work together to make an even bigger impact for each one.

settings.heading: Artists Building Communities
settings.paragraph: We are proud to present Artists Building Communities as our charity partner for the month of April. ABC is a collective of volunteer artists, activists, change makers, and formerly unhoused folks whose mission is to house as many of their neighbors as they possibly can.

settings.heading: PangeaSeed
settings.paragraph: We are proud to present PangeaSeed as our charity partner for the month of January. Pangeaseed is an international nonprofit organization acting at the intersection of culture and environmentalism to further the conservation of our oceans.

settings.heading: World Wildlife Fund
settings.paragraph: We are proud to present WWF as our charity partner for the month of March. WWF has teams of experts working in almost 100 countries to put nature on the path to recovery for the benefit of people and wildlife.

settings.heading: PTSD UK
settings.paragraph: We are proud to present PTSD UK as our charity partner for the month of February. PTSD UK is the only charity in the UK dedicated to raising awareness of post-traumatic stress disorder â€“ no matter the trauma that caused it.

settings.heading: The Smile of the Child
settings.paragraph: We are proud to present The Smile of the Child as our charity partner for the month of May. "The Smile of the Child" provides solutions to the daily vital needs of thousands of children navigating through difficult times with its values for Care, Dignity, Equality as its compass.

settings.heading: Greenpeace
settings.paragraph: Greenpeace is known for its direct actions and has been described as one of the most visible environmental organisations in the world.

settings.heading: The Rainforest Trust
settings.paragraph: In 1988, three visionary conservationists had a bold plan: to purchase and protect threatened rainforests and save endangered wildlife through community engagement and local partnerships.

settings.heading: Amazon Watch
settings.paragraph: Amazon Watch was founded in 1996 to protect the rainforest and advance the rights of Indigenous peoples in the Amazon Basin. We partner with Indigenous and environmental organisations in campaigns for human rights, corporate accountability, and the preservation of the Amazon's ecological systems.

settings.heading: Animal Love
settings.paragraph: A non-profit, no-kill charitable organization, founded on the belief that all animals deserve respectful and loving treatment and must be protected by humans as well as by law.

settings.heading: Zero loss of natural habitats
settings.paragraph: WWF is working for 30 percent of all land, seas, and freshwater to become protected areas or community conserved areas â€“ with a further 20 percent managed sustainably.Â We also aim to restore 350 million hectares of forest and our most valued rivers.

settings.heading: Zero extinction of species
settings.paragraph: We are striving to halt species extinction caused by human activity, with wildlife populations stable or increasing. To achieve this, we need to end illegal over-exploitation and trade, sustainably use legally taken wildlife and wildlife products, reduce conflicts between people and wildlife, minimize incidental capture, and reduce the threat to wildlife caused by invasive species.

settings.heading: Halve footprint of consumption and production.
settings.paragraph: We need action on many fronts, including 50 per cent of agriculture and aquaculture production to be sustainably managed, and a doubling in sustainably managed fisheries. Food loss and waste must be halved, pollution stopped, and the global footprint of our diets halved. We also need to see a halving of greenhouse gas emissions from 2010 levels.

settings.heading: Nationwide
settings.paragraph: Services for all children in Greece regardless of ethnicity and/or religion and therapeutic actions for children victims of any form of violence.

settings.heading: 365 days a year
settings.paragraph: Prevention activities for all children in Greece to address phenomena of violence and/or child disappearances, as well as provide medical preventative examinations.

settings.heading: 24 hours a day
settings.paragraph: Actions of Intervention for children victims of any form of violence, missing children, children with health problems, children living in poverty or threatened by poverty.

settings.heading: Protect the Oceans
settings.paragraph:
Planet Earth is mostly ocean. Water covers over 70% of the planet's surface. The seas harbour incredible wildlife, provide food for billions and help balance our climate. They are the source of all life on earth, and every day, they continue to nurture us.

We need to protect our oceans because without them life on Earth would not â€“ and cannot â€“ exist.

settings.heading: Climate Emergency
settings.paragraph:
We need to put people above the fossil fuel industry and truly act on climate.

Weâ€™re facing extreme weather events, catastrophic loss of wildlife and a crisis over future access to freshwater and food.

Catastrophic climate change can only be avoided if nations rapidly cut their greenhouse gas emissions, keep the fossils in the ground and change the current system for how we use the resources of our planet.

settings.heading: Protecting Forests
settings.paragraph: Forests are crucial for the health and well-being of people, wildlife and our planet. Real forest is so much more than just trees. Theyâ€™re home to roughly two-thirds of all land-dwelling plant and animal species, critical lifelines for communities big and small, and one of the last lines of defense against catastrophic climate change.

settings.heading: Saving Species
settings.paragraph:
Fighting to save species from extinction, Rainforest Trust strategically targets biodiversity hotspots that hold the greatest concentrations of endangered flora and fauna and preserves these lands through the creation of new protected areas.

With proper ongoing management, these nature reserves combat the major challenges that threaten endangered species by safeguarding vitally important habitat while preventing hunting and poaching.

settings.heading: Protecting Our Planet
settings.paragraph:
Earthâ€™s rainforests provide the world with freshwater and oxygen, and they also mitigate the effects of climate change. Despite this, less than half of the tropical rainforest biome remains as intact forested landscapes, and 70,000 more acres are lost each day.

To stop this devastation, Rainforest Trust is working diligently to establish new protected areas and safeguard the planetâ€™s remaining tropical forests.

settings.heading: Caring for Communities
settings.paragraph:
The long-term success of a protected area is not possible without the support of its surrounding community. Rainforest Trust embraces a bottom-up approach to conservation, empowering local partners and community members to spearhead the creation of each reserve and manage it effectively.

Additionally, Rainforest Trustâ€™s protected areas often improve the lives of local people by providing jobs, education and health benefits while assisting indigenous communities gain legal recognition of their lands.

settings.heading: Stop Amazon Destruction
settings.paragraph:
The Amazon is the world's largest terrestrial carbon sink and plays a critical role in regulating the global climate. Yet this global treasure is at great risk â€“ already more than 20% has been deforested.

Amazon Watch protects millions of acres of rainforest every year by partnering with Indigenous peoples â€“ the best stewards of the forest â€“ to directly challenge the corporate and government powers that threaten the Amazon and our climate.

settings.heading: Advance Indigenous Solutions
settings.paragraph:
The knowledge, cultures, and traditional practices of our Indigenous partners contribute greatly to sustainable and equitable stewardship of the Amazon and all of Mother Earth.

Amazon Watch promotes these Indigenous-led solutions, such as green development and autonomous solar power, and expands capacity for Indigenous leaders, especially women, to maintain their autonomy and sovereignty for the stewardship of their ancestral territories.

settings.heading: Support Climate Justice
settings.paragraph:
Addressing climate change and environmental destruction must also redress past harm, bring bad actors to justice, support activists who put their lives on the line, and build solidarity.

Amazon Watch holds governments and corporations accountable, defends Earth Defenders against threats and attacks, holds open the doors of the international stage for our Indigenous partners, supports bonds of solidarity between Indigenous peoples, and channels outside support for our Indigenous partners.

settings.heading: Campaign Goal
settings.paragraph:
Artists Building Communities (ABC) is building tiny homes in Oaklandâ€™s homeless encampments to provide emergency shelter to the unhoused population.

Using community sourced donations and volunteer labor, ABC has built 7 emergency tiny homes for $3,000 each in 2020.

Andy okay is helping ABC in their mission to raise $30,000 in donations through their current GoFundMe campaign to build 7 more tiny homes in the Oakland community.

settings.heading: About Pangeaseed
settings.paragraph:
PangeaSeed Foundation aims to unify and connect individuals around the world, opening a dialog to share ideas and develop a better global understanding of our connection with the oceans. Through education, awareness and action we are working together to solve this environmental crisis.

Through PangeaSeed Foundation, we strive to grow together to develop a better global understanding of the need to protect oceans and conserve its valuable resources. The â€œSeedâ€ in our name, is also an acronym for 'Sustainability, Education, Ecology and Design', the four core pillars we stand by.

settings.heading: Global Goals
settings.paragraph:
All around the world, people are waking up to the deepening crisis of nature loss. A growing realization that nature is our life-support system. And that nobody will be spared from the impacts of its loss.Â 

Â Here at WWF, we are working to sustain the natural world for the benefit of people and wildlife.Â Â 

Â Working alongside many others, we are encouraging people to support a new and positive direction for our world â€“ one where both people and nature thrive.Â 

Â And we are calling on world leaders to commit to a New Deal for Nature and People as comprehensive as the global climate deal â€“ halting nature loss and putting it on the path to recovery by 2030, as well as supporting global action on climate change and sustainable development, through three science-based targets:

settings.heading: About PTSD UK
settings.paragraph:
PTSD UK was founded in 2015 by Jacqui afterÂ her own experiences suffering with PTSD. The lack of understanding, provisions and information made Jacqui realise that help and education is needed for those struggling with PTSD â€“ along with their friends and family.

PTSD UK is currently the only charity in the UK dedicated to raising awareness of post-traumatic stress disorder â€“ no matter the trauma that caused it.

Evidence suggests that around 70% of people who suffer with PTSD in the UK do not receive any professional help at all, and many of those who are aware they have it are not getting the help and support they need.

Our charity aims to raise awareness of PTSD in three main areas â€“ itâ€™s causes, symptoms and the treatments available. These 3 areas are of vital importance to those suffering with the condition.

settings.heading: At a Glance
settings.paragraph:
â€œWe all know and talk about children in the streets that donâ€™t smile. They donâ€™t smile because they donâ€™t have money, no toys, they donâ€™t have any food and, some, donâ€™t even have parents. So, start thinking and stop talking empty words, letâ€™s all unite and give what we can to the poor ones: Albanian children, white and black, they are all just children and deserve to smile. This organization shall be called â€œThe Smile of the Childâ€. So, letâ€™s all help, united we can make it.â€

November 1995. The voluntary organization â€œThe Smile of the Childâ€ is the vision of the 10-year old Andreas Yannopoulos who, shortly before losing his own battle for life, documented this dream of his, in his journal.Â

settings.heading: What We're Doing
settings.paragraph:
We've been campaigning for a green and peaceful future for almost 50 years â€” and we're not stopping now. It's time to rise up like never before and fight for our climate and communities.

We defend the natural world and promote peace by investigating, exposing, and confronting environmental abuse, championing environmentally responsible solutions, and advocating for the rights and well-being of all people.

We take action only where we and our supporters can make the biggest impact, where peopleâ€™s lives are most affected, and where environmental risks are most dire.

With every acre, The Rainforest Trust have grown in scale, scope and determination. Theyâ€™ve already helped protect over 37 million acres around the world and have millions of acres in the pipeline, working toward the security of 50 million acres.

But they donâ€™t just see these acres as land for protection. They see these acres as home to countless species who rely on the habitats contained within. They see them as the backyards of thousands of people who rely on them for fresh water and food supplies. They see them as part of the fabric of this planet we live on.

settings.heading: The Mission
settings.paragraph: We envision a world where the collective rights of Indigenous peoples and the rights of nature are respected and where healthy forests, biodiversity, and the global climate are fully protected by governments, corporations and civil society.

settings.heading: What We Do
settings.paragraph: "Whenever we come across animals who are abused, abandoned, sick or injured, we take action to prevent further suffering and give them a safe and loving home. Â Homeless, injured or sick animals who find their way to our rescue center get proper medical attention and care, and become a part of our family. Our animal friends come from nearby and not so nearby areas, and live with us for the rest of their life."

settings.heading: Together possible
settings.paragraph:
"We think ALL of Oaklandâ€™s most vulnerable communities deserve shelter. Not later but NOW. We can do this using the â€˜Housing Firstâ€™ strategy inspired by the successful movement in Utah that housed 100% of their houseless population in less than a year. We hope to inspire the city of Oakland to adopt this mindset.â€

ABC Co-founder, Annmarie Bustamente

settings.heading: Pangeaseeds Mission
settings.paragraph: To empower individuals and communities to create meaningful environmental change for oceans through Science, Education, and ARTivism (S.E.A.).

settings.heading: Nature loss and people
settings.paragraph: Our goals can only be achieved in partnership with, and in the interests of, individuals and communities around the world. People must be front and centre in this process, with everyone entitled to live in a healthy environment and to have their human rights respected. Find out more about our work by clicking the link below.

settings.heading: OurÂ missionÂ is to provide support and information for anyone experiencing PTSD. We campaign to improve services, raise awareness and promote understanding of the condition and treatments available.
The Smile of Every Child
settings.paragraph: In 2021 â€œThe Smile of the Child" celebrates 25 years of continuous service in support of more than 1.700.000 children and their families. Andreas would be proud of the Ripple Effect of his vision, which still inspires thousands of children and adults.

settings.heading: Mission
settings.paragraph: Greenpeace is a global, independent campaigning organization that uses peaceful protest and creative communication to expose global environmental problems and promote solutions that are essential to a green and peaceful future.

settings.heading: Our Approach
settings.paragraph: Rainforest Trust purchases and protects the most threatened tropical forests, saving endangered wildlife through partnerships and community engagement. Through these highly effective partnerships, we can ensure sustainable results necessary for the long-term protection of tropical ecosystems and the wildlife they hold.

settings.heading: Get Involved
settings.paragraph: The Amazon rainforest is in crisis. It has been for some time. Each of us can take action. We may be the last generation that has a chance to protect this precious gem of our world's cultural and ecological heritage â€“ an irreplaceable source of life and inspiration. Supporting Amazon Watch is a critical way to protect the rainforest, defend Indigenous rights, and address climate change.

settings.heading: Our shelter
settings.paragraph: At the rescue center, every animal gets routine personal attention that includes health and nutrition checks, mood observation and constant cleaning of their living areas. Dogs get two daily walks as well as one hour of â€˜free timeâ€™ in an open area, cats get two hours of â€˜free timeâ€™. Â Other animals (geese, horses, hen, goats, sheep, ducks) have a large open area in which to move around.

settings.heading: Join our mission to raise $30,000 to build 7 Emergency Tiny Homes in Oakland for our Houseless Community Members.
Join our mission to raise $30,000 to build 7 Emergency Tiny Homes in Oakland for our Houseless Community Members.
Working to sustain the natural world for the benefit of people and nature
"If we all come together, we can make it."
settings.paragraph: Andreas Yannopoulos
settings.button: Visit The Smile of the Child

settings.heading: Greenpeace works with thousands of volunteers who are on the inside track of their campaigns.
settings.paragraph: Whether youâ€™ve been an activist for decades or youâ€™re just starting and want to learn how you can help, please take a moment and visit their site to learn more.

settings.heading: With your help, we can make a difference.
settings.paragraph: Every action we take now to protect rainforest will have a lasting impact on the future by maintaining our planetâ€™s critical ecosystems.

settings.heading: We can make a difference
settings.paragraph: Every action we take now to protect rainforest will have a lasting impact on the future by maintaining our planetâ€™s critical ecosystems.

settings.heading: CHARITY PARTNERS
settings.paragraph: We exist to bring stunning art to peopleâ€™s homes while raising awareness aboutÂ nonprofits and their world-changing work. We only partner up with proven and trust-worthy organisations. By focusing our community's efforts on a few selected causes, we can work together to make an even bigger impact for each one.

settings.title: What is Charity of the Month?
settings.answer:
Each month we focus a little more attention on a specific nonprofit organisation we are working with, to spread awareness about their mission and vision.

By dividing our partners into separate months, and share their beliefs with our community for a longer period of time, will help get their message out in a much more efficient way.

settings.title: Why should we work with Andy okay?
settings.answer:
Donations + awareness. One reason is of course the third of the profit from the sold artworks. As we have a â€œPay What You Canâ€-model it is difficult to predict the final amount each collaboration will raise. But looking on previous collaborations a third of the profit generally equals around $100 per artwork. Which of course means times 15-25, depending on the final number of collaborating artists that specific month.

The second part is the reach and engagement. Each and every artist signs up to share the collaboration in their own channels at the release of their art. This means 15-25 of the worldâ€™s leading artists are raising awareness about your cause.Â 

Each nonprofit organization partnering up with us also receives a dedicated page on andyokay.com, with 60.000+ visitors each month.Â

settings.title: Who will we reach?
settings.answer:
What worked so good 5 years ago, sadly doesnâ€™t work as well anymore. Today we have two seconds to grab peopleâ€™s attention. Thatâ€™s why using art to share a message is so powerful, since it makes people stop, and really embrace the information.Â 

We open up a whole new audience for our collaborating partners to talk about their important causes to people that care about our planet, but donâ€™t actively seek out the information themself.Â 

We reach as many females as males, all over the world, spanning from 18 years all the way up to 65+ years. (Almost) everybody loves beautiful art.

settings.title: What does this cost?
settings.answer:
Absolutely nothing. We exist to assist important organizations, not take away anything from their already tight budget. Thatâ€™s why we offer this without asking for anything back. We are here to help.

Of course we would really appreciate if the organization of the month mentioned Andy okay in any of their own channels during some point while the collaboration is live. But itâ€™s really not something we demand or even expect.Â

settings.title: How do I become a charity partner?
settings.answer: Get in touch at naslin@andyokay.com

settings.title: The more you pay, the more we give.
settings.content:
When you buy an artwork at Andy okay, you are free to use our slider and choose the price you can pay.

- â…“ of the profits from your purchase will be donated to the nonprofit that is linked to the artwork.

- â…“ of the profits will go back to the artist who made the artwork.

Our mission is to support nonprofits and artists while providing meaningful art to customers at prices everyone can afford.

settings.title: Give more. Get more.
settings.content:
The more you buy in Art for Causes, the more you'll get.

If you buy 2 artworks you get to choose an exclusive artwork for free with your order.

If you purchase 3 artworks from Andy okay, you'll even get to choose 2 free artworks.

The value of these exclusive artworks are between $149-$795 each, which means this is no doubt one of the best art offers in the world.

settings.title: Free Shipping. Worldwide.
settings.content:
We offer free worldwide shipping on all orders for $59 or more.

If you place an order for less than $59, we have to charge a flat rate of $5.99 to cover a part of our shipping costs.

With our unique production chain, your art will be shipped locally in over 30 of the biggest countries. This makes delivery faster for you, but also reduces shipping distances, customs fees and carbon emissions.

Faster, smarter, greener.

settings.subheading: The low-down on top trends, artist interviews and cool guides that make a difference.
settings.title: The Gallerist

settings.heading: THE GALLERIST
settings.paragraph: Providing you with the latest news and insights on the art world, focusing on gallery artists and their work. Our team of art experts will be sharing their knowledge and expertise to keep you up-to-date with the latest trend.

settings.title: Free Shipping on All Orders Above $69
Free Shipping on All Orders Above $69
Members Club
settings.content:
Youâ€™re two seconds away from unlocking amazing giveaways, exciting competitions, access to our award-winning inspirational newsletter and much, much more.

All free, of course.

settings.heading: Art for Earth lovers
settings.paragraph: Stunning, meaningful art with incredible quality. But affordable. An impossible ask... until now. By matching award-winning artists with important nonprofits, we made it happen...

settings.title: How can you offer such affordable art?
settings.answer: This price is only possible due to the incredible artists involved, who allows us to lower the price significantly for one of their artworks. Without their honorable participation, we wouldn't exist.

settings.title: Will the price effect the quality?
settings.answer: Founded by artists, rest assure that the quality of the product is our top priority. Some of us have been working with paper, details and perfection for over 20 years, and we use all our knowledge (and connections) to bring you something we truly can stand behind.

settings.title: How much actually goes to the cause?
settings.answer:
We donate a third of our profit to non-profit organisations. For each artwork what you choose to donate will go directly to the charity organisation you have chosen.

So anything extra you can give will have a huge impact.

settings.title: How much do the artists get?
settings.answer: Founded by artists, we always want the artists to be fairly compensated as well. We know it's hours and hours of hard work behind each and every one of these artworks. That's why we offer the artists an upfront payment so everyone involved get compensated for their contribution.Â

settings.title: I really want to try it. But first, do you have any guarantee?
settings.answer: No worries. We offer 100% customer satisfaction, or your money back. If by any chance you're not completely happy with any part of your customer experience, neither are we. Just let us know and we'll fix it!

settings.title: Handmade gallery frames for the perfect presentation
settings.content:
Level up your favourite Andy okay art collection with our premium wooden frames. Available in black, white and a beautiful natural oak.

Each frame is handcrafted with perfection and comes with easy hanging hardware so your artwork is ready to hang as soon as it arrives.

settings.title: Popup
settings.content:
Give to yourself and give back.

Our mission is to support charity and artists while providing stunning art to customers at great prices.Â 

Through unique collaborations we can release limited edition art at incredible prices, leaving room for a personal donation to a charity of your choice.

And the best part?

These limited edition drops help to bring important environmental stories into homes and workspaces all around the world creating critical dialogue and inspiring positive action.

Together, with the power of art, we can help save our planet.

settings.title: NEW DROP!
settings.content: The modern take on a real classic. 'A Man From Nirvana' by Norris Yim for Share The Meal live now.

settings.title: Popup
settings.content:
Mat Boards / Passe Partout

Make your artwork complete by adding a mat board, and elevate the look and feel of your artwork even further. A mat board that runs around the edge of the art makes it stand out and come into focus.Â 

It is an absolutely stunning method of framing your piece, and the preferred choice of most galleries and artists all around the world.Â 

In addition to giving your art extra depth, you also avoid the artwork coming into contact with the glass, which protects it against ageing.

settings.title: Popup
settings.content: You can use this popup to display some useful information to your customers.
